main event: A civilian airline observed a single object flying at high speeds near Los Angeles, California on March 25, 1954.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be traveling between 25,000 and 30,000 feet at over 1,500 mph., It left a long fluorescence trail behind it., The object was observed in the air visually., The conclusion of the sighting was that it was an astronomical event, specifically a meteor., The exact length of the observation and course of the object were not reported.
